revised_title: Angular Sensitivity of Fly Photoreceptors: Wavelength Dependence and Limits of Resolution
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to measure the angular sensitivity of single retinula cells in the eyes of Calliphora and Eristalis flies at different wavelengths. They found that the acceptance angle is independent of wavelength and approaches the theoretical lower limit at 500 nm. The results support the theory that the angular sensitivity of fly photoreceptors is limited by diffraction, providing insights into the limits of resolution in insect vision.
